eu.amidst.core.exponentialfamily

Class EF_UnivariateDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.amidst.core.exponentialfamily.EF_Distribution
      • eu.amidst.core.exponentialfamily.EF_ConditionalDistribution
        • eu.amidst.core.exponentialfamily.EF_UnivariateDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EF_Dirichlet, EF_Gamma, EF_InverseGamma, EF_Multinomial, EF_Normal

    public abstract class EF_UnivariateDistribution
extends EF_ConditionalDistribution
    This class extends the abstract class EF_ConditionalDistribution and defines the univariate distribution in exponential family form. It is considered as a special case of a conditional distribution with an empty list of conditioning variables.

    For further details about how exponential family models are considered in this toolbox, take a look at the following paper: Representation, Inference and Learning of Bayesian Networks as Conjugate Exponential Family Models. Technical Report. (pdf)

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public double computeLogProbabilityOf(double val)
        Returns the log probability of a given value according to this EF_UnivariateDistribution.
        Parameters:
        val - a double value. In case of finite state space distribution, the double value can be seen as an integer indexing the different states.
        Returns:
        a positive double that represents the log probability value.
